raw_output:
system
You are a helpful AI for medical imaging.
user
System:
You are an expert educator in medical imaging. From the following slide text,
extract the key technical or scientific concepts that are essential for understanding the topic.

User:
SLIDE_TEXT:
For your homework, I’d like you to draw diagrams for all the pulse sequences we discussed in this lecture. That includes spin echo, gradient echo, diffusion-weighted imaging, and spectroscopy sequences. Along with each diagram, please explain the working principle — how the sequence works and what kind of information it provides.

Also, please watch the YouTube video I mentioned earlier; it will help you better visualize how MRI can even be used for mind-reading research. Try to connect what you see in the video and what we discussed today about MRI signal generation and brain imaging. Then, take some time to read the textbook section on MRI so you’re well prepared for our next lecture on ultrasound imaging.

Thank you, and I’ll see you in the next class.

STRICT INSTRUCTIONS:
- Return pure JSON only. No prose, no markdown, no code fences.
- Each concept must appear verbatim (case-insensitive) in SLIDE_TEXT.
- Assign exactly one category from:
  software | workflow | mathematics | signal_processing | frequency_domain |
  physics | instrumentation | data_processing | reconstruction |
  quality_metric | communication | modality | anatomy | algorithm | ai_ml
- Reject filler or administrative text.
- Output format:
{
  "concepts": [
    {"term": "<exact term from slide>", "category": "<category>"}
  ],
  "evidence": ["<short supporting phrase from SLIDE_TEXT>"]
}

assistant
{
  "concepts": [
    {"term": "spin echo", "category": "signal_processing"},
    {"term": "gradient echo", "category": "signal_processing"},
    {"term": "diffusion-weighted imaging", "category": "signal_processing"},
    {"term": "spectroscopy", "category": "signal_processing"},
    {"term": "MRI", "category": "modality"},
    {"term": "signal generation", "category": "physics"},
    {"term": "brain imaging", "category": "modality"},
    {"term": "YouTube video", "category": "communication"},
    {"term": "textbook section", "category": "modality"},
    {"term": "ultrasound imaging", "category": "modality"}
  ],
  "evidence": [
    "draw diagrams for all the pulse sequences we discussed in this lecture",
    "explain the working principle — how the sequence works and what kind of information it provides",
    "watch the YouTube video I mentioned earlier; it will help you better visualize how MRI can even be used for mind-reading research",
    "read the textbook section on MRI so you’re well prepared for our next lecture on ultrasound imaging"
  ]
}

evidence: draw diagrams for all the pulse sequences we discussed in this lecture
explain the working principle - how the sequence works and what kind of information it provides
watch the YouTube video I mentioned earlier; it will help you better visualize how MRI can even be used for mind-reading research
read the textbook section on MRI so you're well prepared for our next lecture on ultrasound imaging
